definition: thoroughfare/to go straight ahead/to rush/to clash
(of water) to dash against/to mix with water/to infuse/to rinse/to flush/to develop (a film)/to rise in the air/to clash/to collide with

clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes
dose of medicine to be taken in solution/infusion

sentences.english: Wine Granules, sediment muscles swelling, immediate pain relief, not as sore.
sentences.chinese: 用酒冲服，将渣子敷于肿处，可立即止痛，不再成疮。

sentences.english: He sniffed the apples and smelled nothing .
sentences.chinese: 他把鼻子凑到苹果冲服嗅了嗅。

sentences.english: Biwensan can also be taken with water.
sentences.chinese: 避温散也可以用水冲服。

sentences.english: The preparation is orally taten and has less or no bitter.
sentences.chinese: 制剂口服或者加水冲服，苦感减少或无苦味。

definition: to take medicine orally (as opposed to applying externally)
to submit to the law/to obey the law
to reconstitute (a powdered beverage) by adding water, milk etc
medicine to be taken after being mixed with water (or other liquid)
to take medicine orally/oral (contraceptive etc)/to say that one is convinced
to mash/to beat to a pulp
to add water (or other liquid) to (another ingredient such as powdered milk or tea leaves)/to infuse (tea)
